attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp8Oi-DBsJBtaiKFPJ-_description
attribs.current: A laser pistol fires a beam of coherent light that can burn through targets. It is among the most common sidearms, often carried as a backup option by characters who primarily use a different weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp8IJ4r1ZEOjM9lOZSa_description
attribs.current: This modern update to the club is solid metal and 2–3 feet long, with a rubber handle and a loop to make it easy to hang from a belt or wrist. It is a common emergency melee weapon and is often carried by city police and private security forces.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp8K5palM0DSUwyZLb9_description
attribs.current:
Among the simplest and cheapest small arms, semi-auto pistols deliver decent damage for their price and have an average range.

Stagger
If Ruxo scores a critical hit with a weapon with the stagger critical hit effect, the target gains the staggered condition (it can either move or take an action on its turn, but it can’t do both; page 87) for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mp8LlwkQWflzJpOEalV_description
attribs.current: A creature hit by a hesper’s mutating touch attack must attempt a Fortitude saving throw (DC 13). If it fails, the target suddenly mutates! Roll a d10 to determine the effect of the mutation: On a result of 1, the target gains the impaired condition (see the Conditions sidebar below) for 3 rounds. On a result of 2–9, the target gains the hampered condition (see the Conditions sidebar below) for 1 round. On a result of 10, the target gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls for 1 round. A creature can be affected by this ability only once per day.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp8LcCA4Ic8sZcrGBda_description
attribs.current: A creature hit by a hesper’s mutating touch attack must attempt a Fortitude saving throw (DC 13). If it fails, the target suddenly mutates! Roll a d10 to determine the effect of the mutation: On a result of 1, the target gains the impaired condition (see the Conditions sidebar below) for 3 rounds. On a result of 2–9, the target gains the hampered condition (see the Conditions sidebar below) for 1 round. On a result of 10, the target gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls for 1 round. A creature can be affected by this ability only once per day.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mp8NGRgWptdfpJNsVWS_description
attribs.current: A hesper can take the Use a Special Ability action to merge with a power source large enough to completely contain it, such as a fusion reactor or starship engine. While the hesper is merged with a power source, it can’t take actions, but it regains 5 Hit Points each turn that it remains in the reactor (up to its total). A creature who is adjacent to a power source can drive out a merged hesper by taking the Use a Skill action and succeeding at a Technology skill check (DC 13; see the Skill Checks sidebar on page 6). A hesper who is driven out in this way can’t merge with the same power source for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNad-3NeJE0ZvAluK5_description
attribs.current: When a hesper takes cold damage, it takes 50% extra damage (rounded down).

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mp8M8ks-YoSfjGtyQQW_description
attribs.current: Hesper touches an enemy or object with an object it's holding that uses electricity. Make a melee attack roll (page 78) against the target. If the hesper hits, its electrical device surges out of control, dealing 4d6 electricity damage to its target. Alternatively, the hesper can touch an electrical device its target is wearing (or a target that is itself an electrical device, such as a robot) directly, gaining a +2 bonus to its attack roll.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mp8MC-JnOsGtBOBYZEl_description
attribs.current: Hesper collects the heat generated by nearby bodies and devices and vent it outward in a 15-foot cone (page 83), dealing 2d8 fire damage to creatures and objects in the area. Each creature in the area can attempt a Reflex saving throw (DC = 15), taking only half damage (rounded down) if it succeeds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mp8MF28yy835UFEelcm_description
attribs.current: Hesper shoots a ray of acid, cold, electricity, or fire (choose each time you cast this) at an enemy or object. Make a ranged attack roll (page 79) against it. If the hesper hits, the ray deals 1d4 damage of the chosen energy type.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mp8MGYViC-civ40PK6w_description
attribs.current: This spell repairs damaged objects and constructs, restoring 1d4 Hit Points. If the Object has the Broken condition, this condition is removed if the Object is restored to at least half its original Hit Points. All of the pieces of an Object must be present for this spell to function. A Construct can benefit from this spell only once per day. Magic Items can be repaired by this spell, but Magic Items that are destroyed don’t have their magic Abilities restored. This spell doesn’t reverse effects that warp or otherwise transmute items, but it can still repair damage dealt to such items.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mp8PJ7ICIXtDeb8EA9v_description
attribs.current: Sub-Commander Skryz can take the Use a Special Ability action to screech, putting all non-goblins within 30 feet on edge. Those creatures must succeed at a Will saving throw (DC 13) or gain the hampered condition (page 94) for 1d4 rounds. Any creature that hears the disturbing screech can’t be affected by it for 24 hours thereafter.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp9pOBKv9AkZD8Dt9CO_description
attribs.current:
This light, compact weapon is worn over other clothing and armour. It converts punch attacks into thunderclaps of sonic energy. Pulse gauntlets are popular backup melee weapons among soldiers who focus on using ranged weapons.

Knockdown
If an aeon guard scores a critical hit with a weapon with the knockdown critical hit effect, the target is knocked to the ground and loses its next move. Ysoki are immune to the knockdown critical hit effect thanks to their moxie racial trait (page 23).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCOpor9I5g6fNNYdmO_description
attribs.current: An asteroid louse that hits with its attach attack fastens itself to its target, gaining cover (+4 bonus to its AC) and a +2 bonus to attack rolls. While attached, the louse can attack only the creature it is attached to, and it can’t move—it instead moves with the creature it is attached to. A creature with an asteroid louse attached to it can remove the louse by succeeding at a Strength ability check (DC 10; Heroes’ Handbook 71). The louse can detach from its target at the beginning of the louse’s turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCPfv77EWvx8KH1mZE_description
attribs.current:
A barathu’s body is mutable and can adapt to many different situations. At the end of its movement, a barathu can reshape its body and adjust its chemistry to gain one of the following qualities until the start of its next turn. Once a barathu has used this ability, it must wait [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds before using it again.

Upper limb refinements grant the barathu a +2 bonus to its melee attack damage.

A toughened dermal layer grants the barathu a +1 bonus to its Armour Class.

Molecular modifications allow the barathu to reduce one type of energy damage it takes by 2 (choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic).

Elongated limbs allow the barathu to make melee attack rolls against creatures that are up to 2 squares away from it (even diagonally) instead of just adjacent creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCPpI8nlzbbm6S5M72_description
attribs.current: A barathu takes no extra damage from critical hits, and it ignores critical hit effects.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCPtKd0wtACVajkoSP_description
attribs.current: A barathu can fly up to 30 feet as its move. See page 77 of the Heroes’ Handbook for more information.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCPwfOa9YLHlNrolTk_description
attribs.current: A barathu can communicate mentally with any creature within 100 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpCQZGPrEb9xGUTIRWs_description
attribs.current:
Bone trooper fires two missiles of magical energy that strike enemies unerringly (the creatures must still be valid targets) and deal 1d4+1 force damage each. The bone trooper can’t target specific parts of a creature, and objects aren’t damaged by this spell.

Bone trooper can target one or two enemies within 15 feet of one another, but each missile can strike only one creature. The bone trooper must choose targets before it rolls damage.

If the bone trooper gives up its move on the turn it casts this, it can fire three missiles instead of two (at up to three enemies).

If the weapon’s next attack hits (provided it is made before the end of the next round), the attack deals 4d6 additional damage, though if the weapon deals damage to multiple creatures, it deals 2d6 additional damage instead. This bonus damage is of the same type as the weapon’s normal damage.

attribs.current: Contemplative detects the surface thoughts of creatures around them. For the duration of the spell, it can forgo taking other actions to gain more and more information. The next round, and each round thereafter, the contemplative can read the surface thoughts of a target mind in the area. A target can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = 15) to negate this effect. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.current: A crest-eater’s venom spit attack has a range of 30 feet, and if it hits, it inflicts bone poison (see above).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCT9mzuE6E-u7JkuH1_description
attribs.current: A cybernetic zombie self-destructs when it is reduced to 0 HP, dealing 1d6+3 electricity damage to all creatures within 2 squares. A creature can attempt a Reflex saving throw (DC 12) to take half damage (rounded down).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCTKXm5AVba2Z3ESe4_description
attribs.current: A cybernetic zombie isn’t affected by attacks and effects that target its mind or by any effect that requires a Fortitude saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCTOrjG2zqCPvPqfN-_description
attribs.current: A cybernetic zombie doesn’t breathe, drink, eat, heal, or sleep.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCTPyNZgJGOIti4u6j_description
attribs.current: When a cybernetic zombie takes electricity damage, it takes 50% extra damage (rounded down).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpCT72Xl3bh4W19-2wv_description
attribs.current:
An arc pistol generates a tiny lightning bolt that arcs out to strike your target and has a chance of temporarily interfering with their ability to act.

Stagger
If a cybernetic zombie scores a critical hit with a weapon with the stagger critical hit effect, the target gains the staggered condition (it can either move or take an action on its turn, but it can’t do both; page 87) for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCToY10abdqy97rIU5_description
attribs.current: A dragonkin can take the Use a Special Ability action to breathe a 30-foot cone (page 94) of fire. Creatures in the cone take 2d6 fire damage. Each creature can attempt a Reflex saving throw (DC 12) to take half damage (rounded down). Once a dragonkin has used its breath weapon, it must wait [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds before using it again.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCTpcf13OgXIGLY6GX_description
attribs.current: A dragonkin can fly up to 30 feet (Heroes’ Handbook 77) as its move. It must end its movement on the ground or it falls (page 45).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpblAEJsvDPRuceCcnv_description
attribs.current:
Among the simplest and cheapest small arms, semi-auto pistols deliver decent damage for their price and have an average range.

Stagger
If a dragnkin scorse a critical hit with a weapon with the stagger critical hit effect, the target gains the staggered condition (it can either move or take an action on its turn, but it can’t do both; page 87) for 1 round.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Ceremonial Plate, Laser Pistol, Taclash, Mk 1 Shock Grenades (2)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCUTfn1ZmNEcr0Z4N9_description
attribs.current: A drow can take the Use a Special Ability action to create a 40-foot-by-40-foot area of darkness centred on itself, which negates nonmagical light in that area. This darkness lasts for 1 minute. The darkness doesn’t move with the drow.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpCUKPi2JRRwon48QwV_description
attribs.current: Drow creates up to four lights that resemble small headlights. The lights must stay within 10 feet of each other, but they can otherwise move 100 feet per round. A light winks out if the distance between the drow and it exceeds 100 feet. It can have only one dancing lights spell active at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpCULW1RlzPzAA2bJRV_description
attribs.current: Drow detects all magic spells, effects, items, and objects (including those on or affecting creatures) that it can see in range. When the drow casts this, it senses whether any are in range. One round later, it knows how many there are. Another round later, it knows exactly which things are magic. The drow can’t detect magical traps in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpCUYoRk6Xvoxg66Lrk_description
attribs.current: A taclash is a flexible metal whip designed to inconvenience foes as much as harm them. If you have a taclash, you gain a +2 bonus to your attack roll when you take the Hinder Foe action.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpCUYoSeQPSzASZyUMQ_description
attribs.current: A laser pistol fires a beam of coherent light that can burn through targets. It is among the most common sidearms, often carried as a backup option by characters who primarily use a different weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpCUiC4XsFXU9oBhhrn_description
attribs.current: Concussion grenades release powerful concussive waves that are designed to knock enemies to the ground. A concussion grenade I deals 1d4 kinetic damage and knocks targets down, causing them to lose their next move. If a target succeeds at a DC 11 Reflex saving throw, it takes half damage (rounded down) and is not knocked down.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCV82qH2G2lg7e3auK_description
attribs.current: An electrovore can take the Use a Special Ability action to discharge its stored electricity, dealing 1d6+2 electricity damage to all creatures up to 2 squares away from the electrovore. Each creature can attempt a DC 13 Reflex saving throw to take half damage (rounded down). Once an electrovore uses this ability, it must wait [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds before using it again.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpCV9ID5VvXCZIkknZa_description
attribs.current: An electrovore can fly up to 30 feet as its move. See page 77 of the Heroes’ Handbook for more information

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNSNxtUaWubJn4y5Ra_description
attribs.current: An evil envoy can take the Use a Special Ability action to taunt a creature within 60 feet, attempting an Interaction check with a DC of 15 + the creature’s CR or level. If the envoy succeeds, that creature gains the hampered condition until the end of the envoy’s next turn. If the envoy fails, that enemy takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of the envoy’s next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNSPfH7g8QL9NWqDVN_description
attribs.current: Once during its turn, an evil envoy can choose a creature within 60 feet. The envoy and his allies gain a +1 bonus to their attack rolls to hit that creature until the start of the envoy’s next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNSSr16BI5MEwBcK3a_description
attribs.current: This evil envoy has the lashunta magic and limited telepathy racial traits (Heroes’ Handbook 22). You can create an evil envoy of a different race by removing these traits and substituting the new race’s racial traits.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNS8byMqssX5nbJ0fJ_description
attribs.current: An evil envoy detects the surface thoughts of creatures around him. For the duration of the spell, he can forgo taking other actions to gain more and more information. When the evil envoy casts this spell, he detects the presence or absence of thoughts from conscious creatures in range. One round later, the evil envoy detects the number of thinking minds. The next round, and each round thereafter, he can read the surface thoughts of a target mind in the area. A target can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = 13) to negate this effect. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNSAoXcxiTP79Q7bqv_description
attribs.current: An evil envoy targets an enemy with a CR of 2 or lower, causing it to lose its next turn! It can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = 12) to negate this effect. A creature dazed by this spell can’t be affected by it again for 1 minute. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNSAoXcxiTP79Q7bqv_target
attribs.current: One Creature of CR 2 or Lower

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNSCGoL4HZzxNlY6NH_description
attribs.current: An evil envoy can lifts and move a small unattended object from a distance. Once per round, he can propel the object as far as 15 feet in any direction. The spell ends if the distance between the evil envoy and the object exceeds 25 feet. The evil envoy can’t perform complex operations, such as firing a gun or using a computer, but he can shut a mechanical door or press a simple button.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNRzajcCviqJLMJI5l_description
attribs.current: This modern update to the club is solid metal and 2–3 feet long, with a rubber handle and a loop to make it easy to hang from a belt or wrist. It is a common emergency melee weapon and is often carried by city police and private security forces.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNRzrbZQ0m77nDHfld_description
attribs.current: A hail pistol fires tiny darts of super-chilled ice. Its affordable price makes it popular despite its limited range and low damage.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Microcord, Laser Pistol, Tactical Baton, Custom Rig (See Below)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNT8irRxw7WHoaaWIj_description
attribs.current: An evil mechanic can give up her move on her turn to track a creature using her exocortex. This gives her a +1 bonus to attack rolls against that creature. An evil mechanic can track only one creature at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNT9nM7OKzNllOiDK2_description
attribs.current: An evil mechanic’s custom rig is a tool kit she can use when attempting Technology skill checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNTC-OZwojCcgt7JgX_description
attribs.current: Once per day, an evil mechanic can take the Use a Special Ability action to create a personal energy shield that absorbs damage. The shield dissipates after it absorbs 6 damage or after 2 minutes, whichever comes first.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNTDPVvFcHUvaWb3EY_description
attribs.current: This evil mechanic is human (Heroes’ Handbook 21). You can create an evil mechanic of a different race by substituting the new race’s racial traits.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNT0lARzMfkjlWROkV_description

repeating_ability_-MpNUhfKc6bJSlLoR6Xn_description
attribs.current: An evil mystic can take the Use a Special Ability action to touch a creature, communicating 10 minutes’ worth of information in an instant. A given individual can be affected only once per day.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNUjCju7c8TFbxf8VX_description
attribs.current: Three times per day, when a creature deals damage to an evil mystic, that creature must attempt a Will saving throw (DC 13). If it fails, the damage the mystic takes is reduced by 2, and the creature takes 2 damage instead.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNUkYmsl4RT9wjfTnB_description
attribs.current: This evil mystic has the armour savant, darkvision, and fearless racial traits (Heroes’ Handbook 23). You can create an evil mystic of a different race by removing these traits and substituting the new race’s racial traits.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNU7e7AL2FiDYlobN9_description
attribs.current:
An evil mystic gives a living creature one of the following commands, which it obeys to the best of its ability on its next turn. It can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = 15) to negate this effect. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

Approach: The target moves toward the evil mystic as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round, taking no other actions.
Drop: The target drops whatever it is holding. It can’t pick up any dropped item until its next turn.
Flee: The target moves away from the evil mystic as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round, taking no other actions.
Stop: The target loses its next move. It can otherwise act normally.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNU9BNTbHuMKgh5T5Y_description
attribs.current: With a single mental nudge, the evil mystic can unlock the deepest nightmares of a living creature of CR 4 or lower. It attempts a Will saving throw (DC = 15). If it succeeds, it gains the hampered condition (page 86) for 1 round. If it fails, it gains the frightened condition (page 86). This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNU9BNTbHuMKgh5T5Y_target
attribs.current: One Creature of CR 4 or Lower

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNUAD-8O8daSWmuU83_description
attribs.current: An evil mystic overloads an enemy with a glut of psychic information, dealing 2d10 damage to it. The target can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = 15) to take half damage (rounded down). This spell doesn’t affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNUFrvj2nqPGjl7dGd_target
attribs.current: One Creature of CR 2 or Lower

attribs.current: An evil mystic can lifts and move a small unattended object from a distance. Once per round, he can propel the object as far as 15 feet in any direction. The spell ends if the distance between the evil mystic and the object exceeds 25 feet. The evil mystic can’t perform complex operations, such as firing a gun or using a computer, but he can shut a mechanical door or press a simple button.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNUKnaRO1lOJgwSAXi_description
attribs.current: An evil mystic can send a short telepathic message to up to two creatures. Creatures that receive the message can reply telepathically, but the evil mystic can send at most one message each round, and each message can’t exceed 10 words. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNUM96xkZbGHmDZeJK_description
attribs.current: Once cast, token spell enables an evil mystic to perform simple magical effects for 1 hour. The effects are minor. The evil mystic can slowly lift an unattended object weighing 1 pound or less. He can alter items in a 1-foot cube each round, colouring, cleaning, soiling, cooling, warming, or flavouring them. The evil mystic can create small objects, but they look artificial and are extremely fragile (they can’t be used as tools or weapons). Any actual change to an object (beyond moving, cleaning, or soiling it) persists for only 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNU6bP1MfQKXRfwNaG_description
attribs.current:
A battle staff is a long, slightly flexible pole generally made of fiberglass or aluminium, with one end weighted for greater striking power.

Knockdown
If an evil mystic scores a critical hit with a weapon with the knockdown critical hit effect, the target is knocked to the ground and loses its next move. Ysoki are immune to the knockdown critical hit effect thanks to their moxie racial trait (page 23).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNU6bP1MfQKXRfwNaH_description
attribs.current:
This miniaturized flamethrower generates a 15-foot cone of flame, allowing it to damage multiple foes in a single attack.

Blast
Rather than attack a single target, a blast weapon attacks all creatures in a cone (see pages 82–83 for rules on cones). Make a ranged attack roll against each target in the cone—even the evil mystic's allies! If the evil mystic hits one or more targets, roll the weapon’s damage once and apply it to each target he hit.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Carbon Skin, Arc Pistol, Tactical Baton, Tool Kit

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNVcF9dEnWkeZE3s4V_description
attribs.current: When an evil operative succeeds at a Reflex saving throw and would take half damage (or suffer some other effect), they instead take no damage (and ignore any effects). The operative can’t use this ability when they have the helpless condition.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNVdUqaFDZMq5ZZXo0_description
attribs.current: This evil operative has the blindsense, communalism, and limited telepathy racial traits (Heroes’ Handbook 22). You can create an evil operative of a different race by removing these traits and substituting the new race’s racial traits.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNVf3T2Z1Mln7tCcZZ_description
attribs.current: When an evil operative takes the Melee Attack or Ranged Attack action with a basic melee weapon or small arm, they can first attempt a Stealth skill check (DC 20). If they succeed, they gain a +2 bonus to their attack roll. If their attack hits and they deal damage, they also roll 1d4 and add the result to that damage.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNVrTyLB4AfKxiEasU_description
attribs.current:
An arc pistol generates a tiny lightning bolt that arcs out to strike your target and has a chance of temporarily interfering with their ability to act.

If an evil operative scores a critical hit with a weapon with the stagger critical hit effect, the target gains the staggered condition (it can either move or take an action on its turn, but it can’t do both; page 87) for 1 round.

attribs.current: This modern update to the club is solid metal and 2–3 feet long, with a rubber handle and a loop to make it easy to hang from a belt or wrist. It is a common emergency melee weapon and is often carried by city police and private security forces.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Thinplate (with Leapers and Radiation Buffer Upgrades), Autocannon, Longsword, Mk 1 Frag Grenades (2)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNWPwSeW4XRsJiKpp9_description
attribs.current: An evil soldier’s leapers armour upgrade (Heroes’ Handbook 59) gives her a +8 bonus to Athletics skill checks to jump.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNWRIjiWfzopbifz9u_description
attribs.current: An evil soldier’s radiation buffer armour upgrade (Heroes’ Handbook 59) lets her ignore all damage and conditions caused by radiation.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNWSPFCWfPWQYD3Kfe_description
attribs.current: When an evil soldier makes a ranged attack against a target with cover, she gains a +2 bonus to her attack roll.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNWTt505lW3auZUPXR_description
attribs.current: This evil soldier has the cheek pouches, darkvision, and moxie racial traits (Heroes’ Handbook 23). You can create an evil soldier of a different race by removing these traits and substituting the new race’s racial traits.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNWF3Tk70QzeY2GxTe_description
attribs.current: Longswords are heavy, long-bladed weapons made of advanced alloys. The weapon remains a popular choice of soldiers who expect to focus on melee combat, and it has a long history as the weapon of heroes.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNWJEUH6V5bJt2z4Fl_description
attribs.current:
An autocannon fires rapid streams of bullets that severely damage foes and can even knock them down.

Knockdown
If an evil soldier scores a critical hit with a weapon with the knockdown critical hit effect, the target is knocked to the ground and loses its next move. Ysoki are immune to the knockdown critical hit effect thanks to their moxie racial trait (page 23).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpNWmptLIholvNStPOF_description
attribs.current: When a fragmentation grenade explodes, it sends pieces of shrapnel in all directions, dealing 1d6 kinetic damage. If a target succeeds at a DC 12 Reflex saving throw, it takes half damage (rounded down).

gear
attribs.current: Second Skin, Longstrider Armour Upgrade (Installed in Android Upgrade Slot), Disintegrator Pistol, Tactical Baton, Datapad, Tool Kit

attribs.current: This evil technomancer has the constructed, darkvision, and upgrade slot racial traits (Heroes’ Handbook 21). You can create an evil technomancer of a different race by removing these traits and substituting the new race’s racial traits.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNXnZWspBYgJBuDDPB_description
attribs.current: When an evil technomancer takes the Melee Attack or Ranged Attack action, she can use a spell slot to gain a +1 bonus to the attack roll and deal 1d6 extra damage if she hits.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpNXp1H9flLlPsJAnPH_description
attribs.current: Once per day, an evil technomancer can take the Cast a Spell action to magically activate her datapad to cast a spell without using a spell slot.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNXP9T6Mv52XS8vRHM_target
attribs.current: Up to Two (or Three) Targets, No Two of Which Can Be 15 ft. Apart; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNXP9T6Mv52XS8vRHM_description
attribs.current:
An evil technomancer fires two missiles of magical energy that strike enemies unerringly (the creatures must still be valid targets) and deal 1d4+1 force damage each. She can’t target specific parts of a creature, and objects aren’t damaged by this spell.

The evil technomancer can target one or two enemies within 15 feet of one another, but each missile can strike only one creature. She must choose targets before it rolls damage.

If the evil technomancer gives up her move on the turn she casts this, she can fire three missiles instead of two (at up to three enemies).

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNXQP6qVUaDZWXoNUb_description
attribs.current: An evil technomancer weave nearby photons into an illusory holographic image that can take almost any form she can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, robots, and living creatures. The image has no sound, smell, texture, or temperature, and it can’t extend beyond four 10-foot cubes. The evil technomancer can move the image within the limits of the size of the effect. Each time the evil technomancer casts this, she can take the Use a Special Ability action on subsequent turns to maintain the hologram; this doesn’t use more spell slots.

It can attempt a Will save (DC = 17) to negate this spell when the gray cast it, and while affected by the spell, at the end of each of its turns it can attempt a new saving throw to end it. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MpNZuDGzMnvJLxHf89l_description
attribs.current:
Gray gives a living creature one of the following commands, which it obeys to the best of its ability on its next turn. It can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = 16) to negate this effect. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

Approach: The target moves toward the gray as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round, taking no other actions.
Drop: The target drops whatever it is holding. It can’t pick up any dropped item until its next turn.
Flee: The target moves away from the gray as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round, taking no other actions.
Stop: The target loses its next move. It can otherwise act normally.

The next round, and each round thereafter, it can read the surface thoughts of a target mind in the area. A target can attempt a Will saving throw (DC = 13) to negate this effect. This spell does not affect creatures with the unliving defensive ability.

attribs.current: A junklaser is just like a laser pistol (Heroes’ Handbook 62), except it malfunctions when a creature attacks with it and rolls a natural 1 (a 1 is showing on the d20 before any bonuses are added). In that case, the creature using the junklaser attempts a Technology check (DC 18). If it succeeds, attacks with that junklaser take a –2 penalty. If the creature fails, the junklaser explodes, dealing 1d8 electricity to all creatures within 2 squares (even diagonally), including its unfortunate user! A creature can attempt a Reflex saving throw (DC 10) to take half damage (rounded down).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp8IJ4r1ZEOjM9lOZSa_description
attribs.current: This modern update to the club is solid metal and 2–3 feet long, with a rubber handle and a loop to make it easy to hang from a belt or wrist. It is a common emergency melee weapon and is often carried by city police and private security forces.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Second Skin, Longsword, Semi-Auto Pistol, Mk 1 Frag Grenades (2)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp8KkcCdNt4ZTbILO8Q_description
attribs.current: Longswords are heavy, long-bladed weapons made of advanced alloys. The weapon remains a popular choice of soldiers who expect to focus on melee combat, and it has a long history as the weapon of heroes.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mp8K5palM0DSUwyZLb9_description
attribs.current:
Among the simplest and cheapest small arms, semi-auto pistols deliver decent damage for their price and have an average range.

Stagger
If a space pirate score a critical hit with a weapon with the stagger critical hit effect, the target gains the staggered condition (it can either move or take an action on its turn, but it can’t do both; page 87) for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpPU4ZbJG9Rq6IWxmva_description
attribs.current: When a fragmentation grenade explodes, it sends pieces of shrapnel in all directions, dealing 1d6 kinetic damage. If a target succeeds at a DC 12 Reflex saving throw, it takes half damage (rounded down).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpPUX75LkujPoW2hz1y_description
attribs.current: The organic acid cannon grafted onto a corrovox’s forearm has a range of 40 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpPUYDZzyisTKAlw6-j_description
attribs.current: A corrovox doesn’t need to attempt Athletics skill checks to climb (Heroes’ Handbook 47) to traverse a vertical or horizontal surface (even upside down), and it doesn’t gain the flat-footed condition from climbing.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpPUa-SevJxMOiNfqgK_description
attribs.current: All Swarm creatures within 30 feet of each other are in constant communication. If one is aware of a threat, they all are. In addition, if a corrovox has to attempt a Will saving throw when it’s within 30 feet of another Swarm creature, it can roll twice and take the better result. A corrovox can benefit from this ability only once per round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpPUb4KDV2ecq7k8cLf_description
attribs.current: A corrovox can communicate mentally with any creature within 100 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpPUk2q3HSi06O3WVQA_description
attribs.current: The organic acid cannon grafted onto a corrovox’s forearm has a range of 40 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpPUZDCTfsxXRdHpopu_description
attribs.current: A corrovox can take the Use a Special Ability action to unleash a psychic burst at a target within 30 feet, dealing 3d4 damage. If a target succeeds at a Will saving throw (DC 12), it takes half damage (rounded down).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpPVHbRlAi4dIex3eDE_description
attribs.current: When a verthani succeeds at a Reflex saving throw and would take half damage (or suffer some other effect), he instead takes no damage (and ignores any effects). The verthani can’t use this ability when he has the helpless condition.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MpPVIQJPZBPhp5lbbx0_description
attribs.current: This ability works just like the 1st-level operative class feature (Heroes’ Handbook 36).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpPVC6HhNaEO3wm82cU_description
attribs.current:
This light, compact weapon is worn over other clothing and armour. It converts punch attacks into thunderclaps of sonic energy. Pulse gauntlets are popular backup melee weapons among soldiers who focus on using ranged weapons.

Knockdown
If a verthani score a critical hit with a weapon with the knockdown critical hit effect, the target is knocked to the ground and loses its next move. Ysoki are immune to the knockdown critical hit effect thanks to their moxie racial trait (page 23).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MpPVC6IGwVG51FbpCRV_description
attribs.current:
A forked pistol channels a bolt of plasma at its target. Its boost special property makes it popular with pirates and mercenaries, who like to deal as much damage as possible on their first attack during combat.

Boost
A boost weapon can be briefly supercharged to deal more damage, but doing so takes effort. If a verthani gives up their move before taking the Ranged Attack action (page 79) with a boost weapon, the weapon deals 1d6 extra damage if they hit with it.

attribs.name: culture_description
attribs.current: reduce the DC of Culture checks by 5 when recalling knowledge about starships and vehicle models and parts as well as famous hotshot pilots

attribs.name: stealth_description
attribs.current: ghost specialization: +4 to Stealth checks to make trick attacks

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LdAh-hOGfjvLSM9aIDl_description
attribs.current: Iseph counts as both a person and a machine. Iseph doesn’t need to breathe, and they don’t take any damage from being in a vacuum.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LdAi-u64qJZAS1AoDKH_description
attribs.current: Iseph can see up to 60 feet in darkness (page 73), though this vision is black and white only.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LdAiVADmmlcm91LVG8d_description
attribs.current: Iseph finds emotions confusing, including their own. Iseph takes a –2 penalty to Interaction skill checks (page 48), and others take a –2 penalty to Interaction checks involving them.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LdAigrmckIunzIsEkya_description
attribs.current: Iseph has leapers (page 59), which are armour upgrades normally installed in armour, installed directly in their body! If Iseph gets a different armour upgrade, they can swap out their leapers for the new upgrade or install the new upgrade in their armour and have both.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LdAjGaLteQymFFSKuxy_description
attribs.current: When Iseph takes the Melee Attack or Ranged Attack action with a basic melee weapon or small arm, they can first attempt a Stealth skill check (page 50) with a DC of 20. If Iseph succeeds, they gain a +2 bonus to their attack roll. If Iseph's attack hits and they deal damage, they also roll 1d4 and add the result to that damage. Even if Iseph fails the Stealth check, they can still attack; they simply don’t gain a bonus to their attack roll and don’t add any extra damage if they hit. Action: None.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LdeZDptsUPPkrZjDt2Y_description

attribs.current: Second skin is little more than a skintight bodysuit that offers minimal protection from harm, while including all the environmental protections and basic functions of armour needed to survive in space.

attribs.name: repeating_item_-MpsYfKSDbMIOHp0rDDA_description
attribs.current: This set of springs and haptic-feedback devices installed in your armour's joints makes it much easier to jump long distances. You gain a +8 bonus to Athletics skill checks to jump (page 48).

attribs.name: repeating_item_-LcqQnXPpjGRcRXF6cOU_description
attribs.current: Field rations are a week’s worth of food in prepackaged, ready-to-eat blocks. They tend to be bland, but are fully nourishing—even as the sole component of a diet over several months or years.

attribs.name: repeating_item_-MpsZL5hns4vY8tjZIOy_description
attribs.current: A datapad is a handheld computer that’s able to run advanced programs (for word processing, entertainment, mathematical and scientific calculations, and so on), record and play back thousands of hours of audio and video, and connect to linked devices such as comm units and computers that you can access or that have been hacked.

attribs.name: repeating_item_-LckrWf9PA2Z8YTtMG7c_description
attribs.current: Every suit of armour (page 58) comes with a personal comm unit, but they can also be used independently when armour isn’t an appropriate fashion choice. A comm unit can communicate with any comm unit on the same planet (or a ship in near orbit), and it also includes a flashlight (see above), calculator, video cameras and audio recording (for up to 10 hours of content), and several simple entertainment programs.

attribs.name: repeating_item_-LcktKGwHxelWVO-cDti_description
attribs.current: A tool kit includes all the tools needed to attempt tasks with the Technology skill (page 51). Mechanics receive a custom rig (page 28) for free, which functions as a tool kit. Attempting a Technology skill check without a tool kit imposes a –2 penalty on the skill check.

attribs.name: language
attribs.current: Celestial, Common, Shirren, Vesk; limited telepathy 30 ft.

Blast
Rather than attack a single target, a blast weapon attacks all creatures in a cone (see pages 82–83 for rules on cones). Make a ranged attack roll against each target in the cone—even your allies! If Quig hits one or more targets, roll the weapon’s damage once and apply it to each target you hit.

attribs.name: repeating_item_-MpsrsoS-M8roWhRdJAL_description
attribs.current:
A spell gem is a single-use spell in crystallized form. Normally, only a mystic or technomancer can use a spell gem, though the spellthrower weapon fusion (page 65) can allow other characters to use them as well. 
Every spell gem contains a specific spell. Raia can select the spell when she purchases a spell gem. If the GM uses a spell gem for treasure, they might randomly determine which spell it contains, requiring Raia to succeed at a Mysticism skill check to identify its properties (page 50) if she want to know which spell it contains. 
A mystic can use a spell gem containing any spell that appears on the mystic’s lists of spells (pages 32, 33, and 35), even if they don’t know that spell. A technomancer can use a spell gem containing any spell that appears on the technomancer’s lists of spells (pages 41, 42, and 45), even if they don’t know that spell. Casting a spell from a spell gem doesn’t use a spell slot, but once Raia casts the spell, the gem’s energy is permanently expended and the item crumbles into dust. See the Cast a Spell action (page 82) for more information on casting spells. 
The list of available spell gems, along with the price for each gem and icons for which class or classes can use that spell gem, appears on page 69. Action: Cast a Spell.
